snippet: The state finished the fiscal year on Sunday $6.1 billion in the red. But the comptroller said the backlog of unpaid bills was expected to grow by $1.4 billion by next month.
abstract: Illinois finishes its fiscal year $6.1 billion in the red, but Comptroller Judy Baar Topinka says that backlog of unpaid bills is expected to grow by $1.4 billion by August 2013.
lead_paragraph: The state finished the fiscal year on Sunday $6.1 billion in the red. But the comptroller said the backlog of unpaid bills was expected to grow by $1.4 billion by next month.

headline.main: Illinois: Deficit Is Growing Despite Tax Windfall
headline.print_headline: Illinois: Deficit Is Growing Despite Tax Windfall
